definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Some of the women-teachers are usually proud of their position of being a Diana.
sentences.chinese: 有些女教師常常以保持獨身主義地位而自豪。

sentences.english: The sitcom single woman is never alone for long.
sentences.chinese: 情景喜劇中的單身女人從來不會獨身很久的。

sentences.english: The concept of celibacy carries connotations of asceticism and religious fervor .
sentences.chinese: 修道者的獨身觀念含有禁慾與宗教熱情之意。

sentences.english: This is why, in fact, I have decided to spend this entire year in celibacy.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，這正是我決定這一整年過獨身生活的原因。
爲什麼那些人要選擇獨身生活呢？

sentences.english: Thing One: Being single for so long was, in and of itself, awesome.
sentences.chinese: 第一，長時間的獨身本身是件很棒的事。

sentences.english: I can't accept ur love, cuz i am a celibate.
sentences.chinese: 我不能接受你的愛，因我是個獨身主義者。

sentences.english: He has entered a forbidden area, he is a confirmed celibate.
sentences.chinese: 他已經進入了一個禁區，證實他是一個獨身主義者。

sentences.english: But she knew that he was the type of holy man who promised never to live with a woman, as husband and wife.
sentences.chinese: 而她知道了他是一個立誓獨身不會過夫妻生活的聖僧。

sentences.english: Combined Single Limit Bodily Injury and Property Damage Limits.
sentences.chinese: 組合的獨身者限制身體的受傷和財產損害極限。

sentences.english: That thou consum'st thy self in single life?
sentences.chinese: 你在獨身生活裏消磨你自己？

sentences.english: Rates of non-marriage rise at every stage of education.
sentences.chinese: 不同教育水平人羣的獨身率都有所上升。

sentences.english: The laity, however, everywhere preferred their priests celibate.
sentences.chinese: 然而，俗衆卻到處渴望他們的祭司過獨身生活。

sentences.english: Now, i am a person with single's (unmarried person's) mentality.
sentences.chinese: 人家我現在是獨身主義者。

sentences.english: You can see the smaller pyramids and the Sphinx.
sentences.chinese: 可以看到那些小一點兒的金字塔和獨身人面像。

definition: less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to be successful in business/professional success
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
all one's hopes and efforts come to nothing/futile
first awakening of love (usually of a girl) (idiom)
